author: Jennifer Strausser
comment: It does not work on Android. And because of this I am late to work. It's very inconvienent. I would like it more if it was compatible with Android as it is with IOS. Give me an old-fashioned key.

reply.author: Kisi Inc
reply.content: Jennifer, sorry to hear about your issue - we'd love to help if it's still a topic - you can ping us with details at "support@getkisi.com" and we'll figure it out with you.

author: Stephen Dietz
comment: Preformance has increased dramatically with Android phone. Still doesn't seem quite as good as Apple's but close

reply.author: Kisi Inc
reply.content: Stephen, sorry to hear and we just released a new Android App earlier this month. Let us know if it's still an issue and ping us at support@getkisi.com so we can get this fixed!

author: Morgan Shepard
comment: People say it doesn't work for android, I've never had an issue.

author: Mike Kowal
comment: Got "unexpected error" where all of sudden I couldn't log in...meaning I couldn't get into my office!  Uninstalled and reinstalled and that fixed it so if getting that error try that

reply.author: Kisi Inc
reply.content: Mike - sorry for the experience, let us know if this is still happening - we just launched a new Android app earlier this month and should be flawless :) Ping support@getkisi.com with any feedback and if it's a problem we'll include it in the next release!

comment: Running into same "unexpected error" on Android app.  iOS app is working it seems as well as web dashboard.

reply.author: Kisi Inc
reply.content: Let us know if this is still an issue - ping us at support@getkisi.com so we can help!

comment: Newest version now prompts me every time I open it to turn on NFC, despite having no way to use it to unlock a door. Obnoxious.

author: Chris Ari Sprague
comment: Great for what it does but the NFC prompt is annoying and unnecessary. Please turn that off.

reply.author: Kisi Inc
reply.content: Chris, that should not be happening anymore, is that correct?

author: Chris Peterson
comment: Remember my most commonly used entries and stop with the NFC prompting!

reply.author: Kisi Inc
reply.content: Chris, we are thinking a lot about this request, currently we try to show you the lock you are closest to. If you use a lock and all of a sudden the order permanently changes, it will be problematic for many users to understand what's going on. But maybe we can have a "most used" section in the future.

author: Steven Cai
comment: Wish it got the same UI treatment and support as iOS

reply.author: Kisi Inc
reply.content: Steven, we took your feedback and are treating Android equal to iOS, how do you like our latest version of the app?

author: Gia Boulos
comment: Ugliest interface ever for Android version!!!!!!

reply.author: Kisi Inc
reply.content: Gia - did you see our new Android version? Should be visually much improved, let us know how you like it!

author: Jonny Farringdon
comment: Clear and understandable UI. Works *fast*. I slide on the app, and the door lock unlocks immediately, i am using internet locks, not direct BT or direct wifi (afaict).  The response time is impressive, as it feels like there is no lag. Only con for me: Doesn't exit cleanly, at least when i use the android-back button it goes from screen but stays active, that might be android anyway.

author: Steven Hewitt
comment: Works only half the time. The other half, the connected devices list is empty and is inexplicably automatically fixed when my boss sends the invitation again. Unlocking a door is something that needs to be 100% reliable, not 50%.

author: András Tőkés
comment: App killed my NFC The first time I tried setting up the NFC connection this app showed an error. From that point on I no longer have a working NFC in my phone.

author: Steven Lydon
comment: When Kisi works, it does it without issue. When it doesnt, you're left out in the cold. Cool idea but until it's more reliable, a fob or key is more dependable.
title: Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesnt

author: David Prian
comment: There seems to always be issues. Standing in the cold... again... because of an "unexpected error".

reply.author: Kisi Inc
reply.content: David, let us know if you still have issues and we'd love to help via "support@getkisi.com"

author: Brayan Almonte
comment: Much more consistent than the ios app.

author: Joshua Foong
comment: I hate having metal keys to my apartment, so this was a super awesome substitute as compared to whipping out my stupid keys every time I need to unlock my door with its lousy keyhole.

author: Robert Sanders
comment: When there are multiple locks in your profile, and you get near to one that has bluetooth, the order they are listed on the screen rapidly changes so it is difficult to interact with the one you want. Very awkward. Give me my keycard back.
title: Whack a mole UI

author: Michael Godwin
comment: We have  this thing for the 3 doors I use and if the weather temperature cold enough, it won't perform.
title: Not Very Good

author: Nicolas Gramlich
comment: Tells me I'm 600 meters away, even though the desired lock is in bluetooth range. (Note: I'm on Marshmallow and the location permission IS granted.)

author: Adriano Orioli
comment: We use KISI at our office, and while there are some Bluetooth errors, the convenience more than makes up for it.

author: ganesh hegde
comment: Says that app is locked to the device running 2.3.1. No idea what that means. And why it has to lock on to one device I don't know
title: Some version problem not letting me use

author: Alon Hillel-Tuch
comment: Crashes
title: Crashes

author: Zev Lapin
comment: My office forces us to use this horrible system. In a dual elevator building, there are lots of problems.. As long as there is one elevator on the floor the other elevator won't go to the same floor. Additionally the app constantly crashes, to the point I just want to yell BC it is the only way I can get into the office. I would be lying if I said I hadn't cursed the kisi app a good number of times. Overall this app is more of a hassle than solution. A hassle that needs its own solution, old school keys.
title: This is the crappiest system EVER

author: Carl Pfeiffer
comment: Simple, comfortable, perfect

author: Bryan Isaac
comment: I had the chance to use this system daily for 6 months at my last office and it was pretty incredible. Giving investors a guest key via email before they arrived made me look good many times, thank you KISI!
title: Such a cool system!

author: Thomas Köhn
comment: Works as advertised! As soon as you have your kisi device set up with your doors, you can easily unlock them all from your phone. Sweet! +1
title: Awesome Home Automation App!!!

author: Julian Norton
comment: I force closed it and it keeps coming back. Uninstalled.
title: Won't stay closes
